titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The snow, which was falling briskly when we returned from Newcastle last night, had all disappeared before day–break, and the temperature was quite mild. M

Bilson, the Architect, came to lunch. I tried to draw from him an opinion on the state of the vaulting, but he was very reticent. However I inferred that he mainly holds with Greenwell that there is no cause for alarm. Then I took Jim to see the School; and arranged that Budworth should celebrate next Sunday, & that the King's Scholars should attend the Choral Celebration next Wednesday. Geordie Gore & Maimie Parker Smith arrived about tea–time.
